warning: push.default is unset; its implicit value is changing in

and maintain the current behavior after the default changes, use:

To squelch this message and adopt the new behavior now, use:

  git config --global push.default simple

When push.default is set to 'matching', git will push local branches
to the remote branches that already exist with the same name.

In Git 2.0, Git will default to the more conservative 'simple'
behavior, which only pushes the current branch to the corresponding
remote branch that 'git pull' uses to update the current branch.

See 'git help config' and search for 'push.default' for further information.
(the 'simple' mode was introduced in Git 1.7.11. Use the similar mode
'current' instead of 'simple' if you sometimes use older versions of Git)

fields.description:
*Repro steps*

# Commit a file with some contents
# Rename the file
# Make a tiny change to the file's contents
# Commit those changes
# Look at the commit in Bitbucket

*Expected*

Bitbucket should tell me that the file was renamed, and highlight the salient changes.

*Actual*

Bitbucket says one file was deleted, and another was added. Bitbucket does nothing to show you the relationship between them.

fields.description:
Hi bitbucket team,

I was cleaning up some branches on our private repo today and because there were a lot of open (unused, we've been bad and not been closing after PR's) branches, I had multiple pages.

When I finished deleting the last branch on page 2 the page tried to reload, resulting in a 404, because there weren't enough branches anymore to justify a second page.

It's just a minor thing, but I thought that maybe it was nice to report.

Kind regards,

Bas Tuijnman
fields.summary: Reloading paginated page 404s after deleting all branches on said page (BB-12655)

fields.description:
At work, my team and I have identified a possible improvement to the pull request feature:

We would very much like to be able to do private pull requests, maybe optional per public repository. So, say private pull requests are allowed or enforced, then the user would be forced or optionally be able to make pull requests private, i.e the source code is not made public until merged.

We identified this as a good requirement because we have private and public repositories at our organisation and for security might not want the data of a pull request being public, for example if a not so advanced user stores a password in a file. So, what we do now is submit no pull requests and just merge a special branch of each user that did some changes. The user then though has to ping the public project maintainer to merge in the changes. It works but it would be nice to have at least a notification in that case. However, putting it in a private pull request would make this much better.
fields.summary: Private Pull Requests to Public Repositories

fields.description:
I'm started to use bitbucket and I wrote a README.md file for my project that links to other md files in my repository.\\
(Using relative links like "docs/OTHER.md")

Unfortunately, bitbucket doesn't seem to handle links like https://bitbucket.org/<ORG>/<PROJECT>/docs/OTHER.md but only\\
https://bitbucket.org/<ORG>/<PROJECT>/src/5c7028e6cd2479bf2a0c23601069e2d3a1733c36/docs/OTHER.md?at=master

Is there a way to write my README.md linking to doc without using the commit sha in the url (and using relative url)?

fields.description:
Hello Bitbucket Team,

I found there are some inconsistencies in pull request hook payload, particularly on {{created}} and {{updated}} event type:

* Pull request {{id}} only available on {{pullrequest_created}}. It'd be great if available on other events as well. For instance, I'm going to use it to trigger tests for every PR create/updates on our CI server.
* In {{pullrequest_created}}, the commit SHA is named (in JSON payload) {{eventname.source.commit.hash}}, while it's {{eventname.source.commit.sha}} on {{pullrequest_updated}} event. Is it intended? I've spent couple of hours in frustration because of this.

Thanks.

Reference: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Pull+Request+POST+hook+management
fields.summary: Pull Request Hook Inconsistency

fields.description:
When I push my go code into my remote bitbucket repository, I don't see my files in github.com package folder instead I see this (this is a screen shot of my bitbucket repository, where I expect to find my go files):\\
!1933085578-Screen%20Shot%202015-03-01%20at%204.03.42%20PM.png|thumbnail!

I used this command to push my code into my remote repository:

{code}
#!git

git add .
git commit -m "message"
git push -u origin master
{code}

When I log into my Bitbucket account, I expect to see my go files inside the "drakecheckin/src/github.com/coopernurse" directory. However I do not see my go file instead I see an arrow pointing to a bunch of characters+numbers.

I am pushing my entire GOPATH up to Bitbucket. Looks like it is referencing something. When I clone, i don't get the file. This might have to do with git referencing?
fields.summary: “Github.com” go packages not showing in remote repository in Bitbucket

fields.description: Since pull requests are automatically updated with changes in the branch from which they came, reviewers are notified of every push to the branch. If a pull requests has been made, reviewers added and then substantive changes are required, it would be nice to be able to remove reviewers so they don't get the notifications and then they could be re-added once those changes are finished.

fields.description:
Hi,

We are having an issue with pull and merge when more than one developers try to push changes to the same project and same branch, this comes when we use large visual studio solutions having more than 10 projects in same solution. Comparatively small projects are working fine and we use visual studio 2012 with GitExtensions-2.48 and GitSccProvider. Also when the release engineer try to pull the changes from the developers most of the times we have to delete the local repository and clone again because pull branch also not working properly, it shows the branch has merged with the new branch name also but the source code is still older one. Do you have any recommended extension for visual studio projects and do we need to switch to command line option rather than GUI extensions ?
fields.summary: Muliple developers in same visual studio project

fields.description:
Mentioned by Brian Westrich in issue [7016|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5811/support-two-factor-authentication-bb-7016#comment-15917369]:

bq. If there was a checkbox I could click in my bitbucket profile settings that disabled all logins except those via my google account or ssh keypairs, I think I'd have all I need.


The lack of 2FA has stop many users from start or continue using BitBucket. While waiting for Atlassian ID implementation, disable email/password login can let users benefit from 2FA protection right away.
fields.summary: Option to disable username and password login (BB-13647)

fields.description:
So, creating a new repository by doing an import from a gitlab server.

Network connection dies after 15 hours of the import being attempted.

(note that the repo is about 1 gig in size, but even so, I was not expecting 15 hours)

Now the repo in bitbucket is unreachable.

nousapps/nousgoals-mobile is the repo location.

I created a new repo (nousgoals/nousgoals-mob) from my computer's copy of the repo, and it took about 3 hours... so there was no reason that it should have been taking 15 hours.

But in any case: there should be a tool to KILL completely a stuck or broken repo.

fields.description:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Several of our developers complained that they can't git push their changes with error unpacker error and Updates were rejected because a pushed branch tip is behind its remote counterpart.

Following is the screen capture. Could you please let know how to fix this probelm and what caused it? Due to the git push error, they can't work on the development now.

Thanks for your help!

$ git fetch

$ git pull\\
Already up-to-date.

$ git push

warning: push.default is unset; its implicit value is changing in\\
Git 2.0 from 'matching' to 'simple'. To squelch this message\\
and maintain the current behavior after the default changes, use:

git config --global push.default matching

To squelch this message and adopt the new behavior now, use:\\
git config --global push.default simple

When push.default is set to 'matching', git will push local branches\\
to the remote branches that already exist with the same name.

In Git 2.0, Git will default to the more conservative 'simple'\\
behavior, which only pushes the current branch to the corresponding\\
remote branch that 'git pull' uses to update the current branch.

See 'git help config' and search for 'push.default' for further information.\\
(the 'simple' mode was introduced in Git 1.7.11. Use the similar mode\\
'current' instead of 'simple' if you sometimes use older versions of Git)

Counting objects: 242, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (57/57), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (61/61), 5.87 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.\\
Total 61 (delta 39), reused 0 (delta 0)

**remote: error: insufficient permission for adding an object to repository database objects

remote: fatal: failed to write object

error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit

To git@bitbucket.org:straighterline/magento.git

! [rejected]        feature/SL-2666 -> feature/SL-2666 (non-fast-forward)

! [remote rejected] feature/SL-3180 -> feature/SL-3180 (unpacker error)

! [remote rejected] feature/SL-3288 -> feature/SL-3288 (unpacker error)

! [rejected]        master -> master (non-fast-forward)

error: failed to push some refs to 'git@bitbucket.org:straighterline/magento.git'**

hint: Updates were rejected because a pushed branch tip is behind its remote

hint: counterpart. If you did not intend to push that branch, you may want to

hint: specify branches to push or set the 'push.default' configuration variable

hint: to 'simple', 'current' or 'upstream' to push only the current branch.
fields.summary: git push error: unpacker error and Updates were rejected because a pushed branch tip is behind its remote counterpart

fields.description:
well., i see a some problems for bitbucket (for github all works fine)

for example:

* We have a some commit/s
* And this has been pushed on bitbucket & github servers,
* Then, with web accessing we can see new chnages in bitbucket.org/3F/<repo>/commits/

However! if we try to clone this with command - git clone ... well:

* For github is all ok, i.e. we can see new commit/s
* For bitbucket - we can't see this after push, only after ~25-30min!

This important for CI, because after push should be executed POST Hook, and you can see the next fails:

* https://ci.appveyor.com/project/3Fs/vssolutionbuildevent/build/build-11

problem not with appveyor, because i tested this on my pc:

{code}
#!bash

git clone -q --branch=hotfixes https://bitbucket.org/3F/vssolutionbuildevent.git C:\projects\vssolutionbuildevent
git checkout -qf 74d34e87a78c
error: pathspec '74d34e87a78c' did not match any file(s) known to git.
{code}

i.e. i can't see any new changes in the new cloned repo!

for github no any problems, for bitbucket this worked after ~25min, and you can also see this successful build:

* https://ci.appveyor.com/project/3Fs/vssolutionbuildevent/build/build-12

it's not a single problem, you also can see this for example:

* https://ci.appveyor.com/project/3Fs/vssolutionbuildevent/build/build-9
* https://ci.appveyor.com/project/3Fs/vssolutionbuildevent/build/build-10

maybe this problem only for current repo o_O but i also tested this with github, and...
fields.summary: problem/long delays with updates repo after push

fields.description:
I tried to create a new repository but when clicking save button an error message was shown explaining that this repository name already exist.\\
I checked on the whole group to see if it already exists and I can confirm that is a new name.\\
It is a similar name but not exactly the same, we have another repository with the same initial 60 characters but before those chars it is a different name.
fields.summary: Cannot create a new repository due to a wrong name duplicity

fields.description:
The newish pull request tasks are great but I noticed that in our team almost all comments would correspond to a task (since the code is mostly commented when there is an issue with it that should be fixed).

Using tasks however we'd need to create a task for each of the comments (because comments are on lines of source files, they should stay) which is tedious.

Couldn't we have a feature that ideally makes a comment into a tickable task as well (think "Is also a task" checkbox under the comment), or a feature that copies the comment to a task with one click (think "Create task from this comment" button).
fields.summary: Pull request comments as tasks (or create PR tasks from comments) (BB-12651)

fields.description:
Bitbucket has recently become highly problematics to use. I would like the following as problems:

# Much slower to push and pull to git repos. These often result in various errors listed below:
# Getting various error messages:

#* fatal: Couldn't find remote ref XXX
#* fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
#* ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Such errors are impacting our companies productivity.
fields.summary: Availability issues

fields.description:
We rely on bitbucket for source control as well as deployments.  We cannot push updates or code commits  as well as pull request.  We cannot access the site or use ssh.

All services are showing down without any reported incidents.

http://status.bitbucket.org/#month
fields.summary: Something went wrong. - Bitbucket is down

fields.description:
I have a team account that is initially called team200000 and I've integrated it with HipChat. Then later on I changed my team account name to team2000002, but it would not change in the HipChat integration section.

!153702794-hipchat1.JPG|thumbnail!

Removing the initial integration, and reintegrate it with the current account name will not be successful; it'll still state that we haven't connect any repositories to HipChat yet.

!1800171080-hipchat3.JPG|thumbnail!

!2950348244-hipchat4.JPG|thumbnail!

Refreshing the page will simply bring back the original page with the original account name.

!5508432-hipchat5.JPG|thumbnail!

However, it still integrates anyway, just that the UI in Bitbucket doesn't update to the new account name.

!1811552328-hipchat6.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Changed Bitbucket account name won't update in HipChat integration's UI (BB-13646)

#!console


OpenSSH_6.6.1, OpenSSL 1.0.1f 6 Jan 2014
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: /etc/ssh/ssh_config line 19: Applying options for *
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [131.103.20.168] port 22.
debug1: connect to address 131.103.20.168 port 22: Connection timed out

ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Connection timed out
{code}

I am not behind any firewall blocking 22.\\
Thanks for helping!
fields.summary: Unable to connect with SSH

fields.description:
I think this is what the fellow in Issue BCLOUD-5907 was describing and that his issue was incorrectly understood.

The manifestation of this problem is the Bitbucket web interface generates an invalid url on the view commits page.  This url is not user provided, except in the sense that user data is incorrectly processed by the site.

The page where users can view a list of commits has a column with clickable link on the commit hash, and additional links in the commit remark column for each commit where there is a numeric entity such as 20140904.  This is intended to refer to a date, not a commit!  Bitbucket incorrectly generates links to such terms without ascertaining their validity as commit hashes.
fields.summary: View Commits Page appears to generate URLS from numerics in commit remark (BB-3112)

fields.description:
An example would be writing {{&}} followed by: {{copy}}. Found by writing this snippet:\\
Rather than using this package, you'll want to use:

{code}
from HTMLParser import HTMLParser

HTMLParser.unescape.__func__(HTMLParser, 'ss©')
{code}

PS: To replicate, just click "Edit" on [my comment here|https://bitbucket.org/pypa/setuptools/issue/348/typeerror-not-a-package-cgi#comment-15769947]
fields.summary: Renders ampersand HTML entities in edit box :(

fields.description:
Right now when viewing a Pull Request in BitBucket, {{*.ico}} files are not displayed correctly in many cases, depending on the way the file was saved. {{*.ico}} files can be saved in a couple of different formats. If the {{*.ico}} file only contains a single image, then it already is displayed correctly. But this is unusual. Typically, {{*.ico}} files will have multiple images embedded inside of them. I use a free program called IcoFX to generate my {{*.ico}} files, and I know it stores the following different versions of the same file inside the single file:

# 512x512 - 32 colors
# 256x256 - 32 colors
# 48x48 - 32 colors
# 32x32 - 32 colors
# 16x16 - 32 colors
# 48x48 - 8 colors
# 32x32 - 8 colors
# 16x16 - 8 colors
# 32x32 - 4 colors
# 16x16 - 4 colors

With files like these, currently the BitBucket image previewer shows a blank square instead of the image.

What it should do: display the largest available image with the most colors available. So in the example above it would show the 512x512 (32 colors) version.
fields.summary: Image Previewer should display embedded ICO files correctly (BB-13560)

fields.description:
It would be great to allow pre-fill issue title and creation like this

https://bitbucket.org/romainneutron/test/issues/new?title=new%20issue%20title

It would open the new issue form with "new issue title" pre-fill for the title. It's very useful and available on Github and Gitlab, see for example https://github.com/romainneutron/Tip-Top/issues/new?title=Hello%20Romain

We could allow our code quality analyser SensioLabsInsight (insight.sensiolabs.com) to be able to prepare new issues for users

fields.description:
I forked from a repository, and then from the forked repository I created a branch called second, and did a Pull Request to merge with the original repository. Before merging, I checked on the line that says "close second after pull request is merged".

!2324859914-pullrequest1.JPG|thumbnail!

But after I merged with the original repository, the branch second is still not being deleted from the forked repository:

!2070891136-pullrequest2.JPG|thumbnail!

!3666533747-pullrequest3.JPG|thumbnail!

----
Edit by @tboudale : The destination branch may get deleted by this bug in the following scenario:

# Create a repo1 with branch develop. develop must not be the main branch.
# Create a fork of repo2.
# Create a PR from repo2/develop into repo1/develop.
# Merge the PR while also selecting "Close Source Branch"
# (BUG) The repo1/develop branch is deleted.
fields.summary: Close branch on PR merge from fork does not close branch in source repository (BB-12657)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
We have a repo https://bitbucket.org/cuinovum/novum_ace.git, and pushed some huge files by mistake.

I used bfg repo cleaner to delete the huge files then did the standard 'git gc' commands to prune, and pushed the changes back to our remote git-repo (as outlined in the BFG instruction: https://rtyley.github.io/bfg-repo-cleaner/).

I did a fresh clone of the repo, and the size is so much smaller now (~385MB) - as expected. However, based on the reported size from the repo page on bitbucket, it is still showing as 1.9GB - with the warning that "the repository size is over 1GB".

As it is, I'm worried that any pushes we do could push it beyond the 2GB hard-limit. Is there a way to speed up the garbage-collection?
fields.summary: git reports the wrong repo size

fields.description:
To whom it may concern,\\
I was wondering if a feature of bitbucket could be added. Now, if I choose MATLAB as language for a repo, it will get a default logo. For every my MATLAB repos, I have to upload a logo individually. I was thinking if it is possible to upload a pool of my custom logos, so that I only need to select logos from my custom logo pool to assign, instead of uploading a logo every time.\\
Regards,
fields.summary: Feature Request: A Pool of Custom Logos for Repo (BB-12121)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a wiki page (probably any markup-page)
# insert a simple link containing ":_"\\
e.g. {{[test](https://www.google.de/#safe=off&q=:_)}}\\
[test|https://www.google.de/#safe%3Doff%26q%3D:_]
# The link now only redirects to the active site instead of the correct page

I found this, trying to link to a http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/MediaWiki page that used ":_" in it's url.
fields.summary: ":_" in Links in a Wiki/New Ticket do not work correctly (BB-12117)

fields.description:
I'm trying to use the BitBucket (BB) {{issues}} feature to track bugs and new features for my projects.  I'm interfacing with a lot of non-programmers right now and they don't have a BB account.  I'd like to @mention them using their email address instead of requiring them to create an account because it is hard to motivate everyone I interact with to sign up for BB.

From BB's perspective, supporting this and allowing non-users to view issues might be a gentler way for BB to on-board users.

I realize this sort of mechanism would create a spam problem.

Apologies if this is a duplicate, but I couldn't find the dup' if it exists.
fields.summary: Ability to @mention and invite non-users of site using email address

fields.description:
'Teams' Dropdown on the top of the page does not show list of the team joined by a user if the team account is not owned by the user, but the user is part of.

Users can browse, push/pull from the repos belonging to the team account, just not able to access the teams they were added into from the 'Teams' Dropdown

EDIT: This issue doesn't affect repos which the user has admin access on.

NOTE: This issue affects the Repository Browser on Sourcetree as well. Repos which the user has read/write access on doesn't show up on the repo browser
fields.summary: Team Members can't see teams on 'Teams' Dropdown (BB-10409)

Luckily is does suggest the correct page as one of the two potential matches, but it's not a great impression.
fields.summary: JIRA Bitbucket integration help link is broken (BB-12114)
